attacks.name: Super Slap Push
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mega Throw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Hariyama

attacks.name: Backward Belt Throw
attacks.text: You may do 80 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Hariyama does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.

data.name: Hariyama

attacks.name: Push Out
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Vortex Chop
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Resistance, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

data.flavorText: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Shove
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Shove
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Slap Down
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Reversal Aura
abilities.text: As long as you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, each of Hariyama's attacks does 20 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance) and damage done by the Active Pokémon to Hariyama is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Brick Smash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Hariyama

attacks.name: Palm Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Spirited Throw
attacks.text: If Hariyama has fewer remaining HP than the Defending Pokémon, this attack's base damage is 80.

data.flavorText: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.

data.name: Hariyama

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire or Water Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.

data.name: Hariyama

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pivot Throw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is increased by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.

data.name: Hariyama

attacks.name: Push Out
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is known for its fantastic strength, but as it grows older, it focuses more on training Makuhita.

data.name: Hariyama ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Commanding Aura
abilities.text: As long as Hariyama ex is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Pivot Throw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Hariyama ex by attacks is increased by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Hariyama

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.text: If this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

data.flavorText: Hariyama that are big and fat aren't necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.

data.name: Hariyama

attacks.name: Shove
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Muscular Slap
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: Hariyama that are big and fat aren't necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.

data.name: Hariyama

abilities.name: Arm Thrust Practice
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon take 10 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.

abilities.name: Heave-Ho Catcher
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

attacks.name: Wild Press
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 70 damage to itself.
